body_content.explanation: an obvious difference between two or more things:
examples: I like the contrast of the white trousers with the black jacket.
The antique furnishing provides an unusual contrast to the modernity of the building.
There's a marked contrast between his character and hers.
Their economy has expanded, while ours, by/in contrast, has declined.
The amount spent on defence is in stark/sharp (= in very noticeable) contrast to that spent on housing and health.
I love his use of contrast (= strong differences between light and darkness) in his later photographs.

body_content.explanation: to compare two people or things in order to show the differences between them:
examples: If you contrast some of her early writing with her later work, you can see just how much she improved.

body_content.explanation: If one thing contrasts with another, it is very different from it:
examples: The styles of the two film makers contrast quite dramatically.
The tartness of the lemons contrasts with the sweetness of the honey.
